summary:
All-round geophysicist with an academic background in real-time image processing (computer vision). 6 years industry experience in research, algorithm development, technology deployment and training. 9 years working in (quantitative) seismic interpretation, well planning, steering seismic acquisition and processing projects and planning and executing VSPs in both development and exploration projects. Worked as a Prodect Owner for agile in-house software development teams developing proprietary seismic interpretation and basin evaluation solutions. 

Specialties: Seismic acquisition, processing and interpretation, 3D visualization, Agile software development.

awards: [{'title': 'Director\'s "UI Impact Award"', 'description': 'Upstream International (UI) Impact Award in the category "People Effectiveness" as part of a team driving initiatives to enhance the impact of geophysics in exploration. My role was to run an initiative around improving the efficiency of seismic interpreters through logging and addressing sources of lost time (due to IT, data and workflow issues) and improving staff competencies.', 'issuer': 'Andy Brown, Shell Upstream International Director', 'date': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, {'title': 'EVP “UI Impact Award”', 'description': 'Upstream International (UI) Award in the category "Waste Reduction" for championing use of novel bathymetry from satellite data technology. This avoided cost, time delay and HSSE exposure related to bathymetry acquisition ahead of a 3D OBC seismic tender, while providing important data to allow contractors to lower risk and uncertainty, leading to lower bids.', 'issuer': 'Andy Brown, Shell EVP Qatar', 'date': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}]
